content: The Coronation Flotilla made its way up the River Thames to Henley on Thames, Oxfordshire, on FridayDozens of well-wishers arranged a special flotilla of decorated yachts, rowing boats and canoes to celebrateRoyal fans took to the River Thames in Henley today to pay their respects to the newly crowned King and Queen.

Dozens of well-wishers arranged a special flotilla with yachts, rowing boats and canoes all decorated to celebrate the historic coronation. Undeterred by the grey and drizzly weather, a convoy of vessels adorned with Union Jack flags and balloons in red, white, and blue sailed on by as onlookers gathered on the nearby banks and on bridges above. While some boats had retractable roofs to spare them from the rain, other fans were forced to wear raincoats as they made their way up the river in Oxfordshire.
